weka.classifiers.bayes.net.search.local

Class EBMC

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.bayes.net.search.SearchAlgorithm
      • weka.classifiers.bayes.net.search.local.EBMC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, OptionHandler, RevisionHandler, TechnicalInformationHandler

    public class EBMC
extends SearchAlgorithm
implements TechnicalInformationHandler
    This algorithm performs greedy search in a subspace of Bayesian Networks to find the one that best predicts a target node.

    For more information refer to:

    G. F. Cooper, P. Hennings-Yeomans, S. Visweswaran, & M. Barmada, (2010). An efficient Bayesian method for predicting clinical outcomes from genome-wide data. AMIA Annual Symposium Proceedings. 127-131.

    BibTeX: 

     @inproceedings{Cooper 2010,
    author = {G.F. Cooper, P. Hennings-Yeomans, S. Visweswaran, & M. Barmada},
    pages = {127-131},
    publisher = {AMIA Annual Symposium Proceedings},
    title = {An efficient Bayesian method for predicting clinical outcomes from genome-wide data},
    year = {2010}
 }

    Valid options are: 

     -D
  If set, classifier is run in debug mode and
  may output additional info to the console
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Arturo Lopez Pineda (arl68@pitt.edu) with functions from Kevin V. Bui (kvb2@pitt.edu)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a given list of options.

        Valid options are: 

         -T <expected parents of target>
  Maximum number of parents
        * 
         -P <nr of parents>
  Maximum number of parents
         -C <nr of children>
  Maximum number of parents
         -mbc
  Applies a Markov Blanket correction to the network structure, 
  after a network structure is learned. This ensures that all 
  nodes in the network are part of the Markov blanket of the 
  classifier node.
         -S [K2|BDeu]
  Score type (BAYES, BDeu)
        * 
         -E <prior equivalent sample size;
  Pess
        Specified by:
        setOptions in interface OptionHandler
        Overrides:
        setOptions in class SearchAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        options - the list of options as an array of strings
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported
